channel.title: The Basic and The Brain
channel.itunes:author: The Basic and The Brain
channel.itunes:summary:
We're the Basic and the Brain - and we’re out here trying to school folks on how basic b**** interests are a gateway to deeper thoughts and topics of conversation, you could say our mission is to try and bring our love of basic interests into the "intellectual sphere" (whatever the hell that means). Interested in how a show about sex can be tied to the science of monogamy? Or how attachment theory makes the Bachelor franchise all that more entertaining? Or what about the most recent Hollywood hook ups and how it relates to our real estate woes as millennials? If so, please come join us as we bring everything bravo and botox to your next dinner party.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: [Season Finale] August 15th - Basic Bitch Quickie (BBQ) Weekly Roundup
item.itunes:title: [Season Finale] August 15th - Basic Bitch Quickie (BBQ) Weekly Roundup
item.itunes:subtitle: Anne Heche, Viral CEO linkedin post, Britney Spears vs. Kevin Federline, Kardashian family update, Millie Bobby Brown, + Jennette McCurdy's Memoir
item.description:
We're closing out season 1 strong with our last BBQ! We reflect on how far we've come this year and what we've got planned for our upcoming second season. Though we're gearing up for an 8 week hiatus ( we promise it'll go by quickly!), this week we're talking through a wide range of topics, from an overview of the Anne Heche tragedy to discussing all the drama surrounding Britney Spears and Keven Federline's ongoing public fight. See below for the topics of the week:



Anne Heche

  • Anne Heche: Accident overview + suffering brain injury and not expected to survive


Viral CEO

  • This CEO Is Going Viral On LinkedIn For Posting A Selfie While Crying After Laying People Off, And People Have Verrrry Strong Feelings About It


Britney Spears versus Kevin Federline

  • Overview of the feud between Britney and Kevin + drama with her kids


Kardashian Family Update

  • Khloe’s custody arrangement for baby son with cheating ex Tristan revealed


Millie Bobby Brown

  • Millie Bobby Brown Says She's "Healing" After She Was "Publicly Humiliated" by a TikTok Creator


Jennette McCurdy's Memoir

  • The Biggest Bombshells from Jennette McCurdy's Memoir, 'I'm Glad My Mom Died'




Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Twitter: @BasicandBrain
  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com

item.title: Netflix's The Most Hated Man on the Internet: Hunter Moore & The Wild Wild West Days of the Internet
item.itunes:title: Netflix's The Most Hated Man on the Internet: Hunter Moore & The Wild Wild West Days of the Internet
item.description:
This week we're covering Netflix's new limited docu-series, The Most Hated Man on the Internet. We're covering everything from Hunter Moore, to Charlotte Laws, to Butthole girl, to the laws surrounding revenge porn in the modern day (did ya'll know there is no federal law against it?), the downfall of Hunter Moore due to hacking and so much more. Honestly the more we think about, the more evident it becomes that there are clearly mommy and daddy issues at play here.


Join us this week as we chat about isanyoneup.com and the wild wild west days of the internet all while psychoanalyzing the shit out of these folks!


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Twitter: @BasicandBrain
  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com

item.description:
This week we're talking through a wide range of topics, from discussing controversy surrounding Beyonce's new album, Renaissance, to Dane Cook's engagement. See below for the topics of the week:


Beyonce's Renaissance Album Update

  • Beyoncé Removes ‘Milkshake’ From ‘Energy’ After Kelis Called Her Out for ‘Theft’
  • Beyonce removes Ableist slur from “Heated” after backlash
  • Monica Lewinsky wants Beyoncé to remove lyric about her from 'Partition'

item.title: Life of a Cougar: Fact or Fiction?
item.itunes:title: Life of a Cougar: Fact or Fiction?
item.itunes:subtitle: Overview of this new season of the Real Housewives of Beverly Hills and an honest discussion on how wrong we get it when it comes to Cougars
item.description:
With Aleena's vanity falling off the wall and her attitude coming in full force today, we provide our thoughts on this new season of the Real Housewives of Beverly Hills, from our honest overview of Erika Jayne's recent problematic behaviour (hitting on Garcelle's eldest son to making inappropriate comments to someone with an eating disorder), Sutton Stracke's lack of emotional intelligence, Garcelle Beauvais' pot stirring and Diana Jenkin's nouveau riche tackiness.


Not only are we getting spicy with this week's commentary, we talk about how some of these women are cougars and go deep into the societal concept of the cougar (which many of our housewives have been seen as), including the definition, what the data tells us, and the potential sociological and biological reasons for the "phenomenon". In summary, can't a girl just get some good d**k and call it a day?


Join us this week as we blow your minds around the reality of "cougars" and come to the realization that we're nearing cougar age ourselves. Watch out boys...we're coming!


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Twitter: @BasicandBrain
  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com



Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Drugs, Grooming & Conspiracy Theories: What Baz Luhrmann's "Elvis" Left Out
item.itunes:title: Drugs, Grooming & Conspiracy Theories: What Baz Luhrmann's "Elvis" Left Out
item.description:
This week we're walking you all through Baz Luhrmann's new film Elvis, the complexity of the artist and man Elvis Presley and why Elvis is getting cancelled (again). Join us as we deep dive into some of Elvis's problematic behaviors from reports of him grooming his wife to appropriating black music, how he was screwed by his manager, his struggles with opioids and the conspiracy theories surrounding his early death.


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

item.title: The Case of Ezra Miller: When Should We Separate the Art from the Artist?
item.itunes:title: The Case of Ezra Miller: When Should We Separate the Art from the Artist?
item.itunes:subtitle: How shitty does someone need to be for us to stop consuming their art?
item.description:
This week, the Basic and the Brain are discussing Ezra Miler's recent bizarre and erratic behaviors. We run through the timeline of events and how things keep getting worse, we discuss public sentiment around Ezra, the reaction of the studios that work with Ezra (why has Warner Bros been slow to the punch with handling the situation?), and discussing various problematic figures in entertainment (people we've collectively loved and others we outright hate) all while debating should we be separating the art from the artist? If so, then when does it make sense?



Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Twitter: @BasicandBrain
  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: June 26th - Basic Bitch Quickie (BBQ) Weekly Roundup
item.itunes:title: June 26th - Basic Bitch Quickie (BBQ) Weekly Roundup
item.itunes:subtitle: Beyonce's new song, Kendall Jenner + Devin Booker break up, and Unfiltered Answers to Questions Men Are Scared to Ask
item.description:
Roe V. Wade has been overturned and though we're grieving and struggling, the Basic and the Brain are trying to keep it positive and light with the topics being covering this week.


Beyonce

  • Overview of Beyonce's New Song "Break My Soul" and People's Reactions


Kendall Jenner

  • Kendall Jenner + Devin Booker Break Up


Unfiltered Answers to Questions Men Are Scared to Ask

  • When you're platonic friends with a man, do you want to be treated exactly how he treats his male friends (in terms of tone, the inside jokes, and the way time is spent), or is there an expectation to be treated differently as a woman?
  • What kind of common behavior makes a guy seem creepy or unattractive?
  • Do women get the pee shiver? I know sometimes I’ll be pissing, and there’s an uncontrolled shiver as I’m finishing up. Does that happen with women at all?





Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Twitter: @BasicandBrain
  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

  • Do women get the pee shiver? I know sometimes I’ll be pissing, and there’s an uncontrolled shiver as I’m finishing up. Does that happen with women at all?

item.title: Social Media Fame & The Evolution of the "Celebrity"
item.itunes:title: Social Media Fame & The Evolution of the "Celebrity"
item.itunes:subtitle: Diving into the Jennifer Aniston backlash on the dilution of the "Actor"
item.description:
This week we're tackling the backlash our beloved Jennifer Aniston faced after making some comments around the "dilution of the actor's job" due to the rise of social media fame across YouTube, Instagram and TikTok. Was she wrong in her commentary? Was she right? To try and answer these questions, we deep dive into the evolution of social media across the years, the differences between online celebrities/influencers versus traditional celebrities (even with the change in entertainment models from traditional to the expansion in streaming services), and what encompasses social media fame.

item.title: 36-24-34: How Far Should Celebrities Go For “Art” and "Beauty"?
item.itunes:title: 36-24-34: How Far Should Celebrities Go For “Art” and "Beauty"?
item.itunes:subtitle: Tackling Kim Kardashian in that Marilyn Monroe dress and how far should we go for beauty
item.description:
This week the basic and the brain are tackling Kim Kardashian's recent response to the backlash she received for losing an unhealthy amount of weight ahead of the Met Gala in order to fit the classic and timeless museum piece (a former Marilyn Monroe dress). Now that we know the dress was actually damaged and that her weight loss didn't help with maintaining the integrity of the original, we discuss how far is too far when celebrities transform for the "art form" and for beauty. We talk insecurities, the dangers of celebrities trying to be "relatable" when they live very different lives with VERY different financial standings and how much of dieting culture has permeated the fabric of our society.



Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

item.title: Barbed Penis Anyone? A Lively Discussion on Male versus Female Grooming
item.itunes:title: Barbed Penis Anyone? A Lively Discussion on Male versus Female Grooming
item.description:
This week on the Basic and the Brain, our dear friend Josh Lee (UX and product designer) joins us for another episode to talk all things grooming. We discuss skin care regimen, hair removal processes (including nightmarish stories of Nair burns, butthole waxing and VERY close shaves to some pretty sensitive parts), the difference in male versus female grooming(including resources/time spent + pain threshold) and dive into the topic of whether or not each sex would bother to continue grooming or partaking in these levels of "self care" if the other sex no longer existed. Is the male or female gaze defining our standards of beauty when it comes to grooming or is this all self inflicted?



Join us this week as we debate who has it worse, give you a detailed story of barbed cat dick and debate whether or not our world is all about survival of the fittest or survival of the prettiest!



Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain

item.title: Getting to Know The Basic & The Brain (Featuring Josh Lee)
item.itunes:title: Getting to Know The Basic & The Brain (Featuring Josh Lee)
item.description:
While we love our Basic Bitch Quickies, we've been a little "Kardashianed" and "Amber Hearded" out so this week our good friend Josh Lee (product and UX designer) joins us to turn the tables around and interview the basic and the brain! Since our inception we've shared loads about our thoughts on all things pop culture, but do ya'll really know us? Josh didn't think so, so he's getting on the mic and asking the hard questions in order to get us to share more about our lives and give our listeners and viewers a sneak peak into our day to day. Ever wonder where we're from, the origin of our names, our religious traumas, how we code switch and what our retirement plans are? Well then this is the episode for you.


Join us this week as we get put on the spot and share a little more than a glimpse!

item.title: The Dolce & Gabbana Sponsored Kardashian/Barker Wedding + Luxury & Fast Fashion Scandal
item.itunes:title: The Dolce & Gabbana Sponsored Kardashian/Barker Wedding + Luxury & Fast Fashion Scandal
item.itunes:subtitle: When we learn luxury brands are prone to scandals and us normies are left with the scandal of fast fashion
item.description:
Now that Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker are back from their Portofino wedding, the basic and the brain do a full on review of the wedding festivities, from the families outfits, to the food that was served. We discuss in depth how the Dolce & Gabbana event appeared to be an attempt to resuscitate their brand and the reason why: aka how D&G has been knee deep in public scandal (as well as other luxury brands...apparently luxury fashion loves its scandals). We walk you through scandal after scandal and how our current problem as "normies" is really fast fashion and it's massive impact on water pollution, CO2 emissions, unethical labor practices and more.


Join us this week as we try to stay positive and provide a bit of escapism is a world where we're constantly inundated with bad news!

item.title: What's Your Sign? The Science Behind Astrology
item.itunes:title: What's Your Sign? The Science Behind Astrology
item.itunes:subtitle: We get it, Scorpios are assholes
item.description:
This week the Basic and the Brain release an "In the vault" episode where we chat about Madz fav topic: astrology. Remember the good old days when we all would read our daily or weekly horoscope in Cosmo or Instyle, etc? Well this episode is where we dig in deeper and showcase that astrology is a lot more than just a few lines in a newspaper column (though we do talk about how it evolved into that format!). We chat about the different signs, the elements, the houses, what each of the big 3 really mean (your moon, sun and rising sun), which astrological signs make the best serial killers, and discuss the history as well as the scientific theory as to why astrology makes sense in our modern world.


Join us this week as we get to watch Aleena and Madz get into the mystic science/art of astrology!


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain

item.title: Am I The A**hole(AITA): Stealing Baby Names
item.itunes:title: Am I The A**hole(AITA): Stealing Baby Names
item.itunes:subtitle: What's in a name??
item.description:
The Basic and the Brain continuing their new segment called "What would you do/Am I the asshole?". This week we talk about a recent reddit post where a pregnant women shares her baby's future name with her sister in law, only to be met with hostility as she'd called "dibs" on the baby name even though she wasn't in a relationship or expected to be with child anytime soon. We discuss cultural variations wrt to names, why we both think the sister in law is a loser and why Aleena's first born is going to have a stripper name (Cinnamon, but with an S).

Adam is a Los Angeles based screenwriter who works in Film, TV, and Digital. He’s worked in the rooms of eight shows across network, cable, and streaming and developed projects at major production companies all over town. You can find his most recent work on Hulu, "New Year, New You" and you can download his two collections of one-act plays MIXTAPE and FIRE SALE on Kindle(and other E-Bookstores of your choice).

item.itunes:title: What Would You Do/Am I The A**hole: Charging Your Guests to Attend Your Wedding
item.itunes:subtitle: Tacky or simply a move away from a traditional wedding model?
item.description:
This week, the Basic and the Brain drop a new segment called "What would you do/Am I the asshole?". This week we talk about a recent reddit post where a bride charged each quest $75 for their dinner plate at her wedding, and people are saying it's actually becoming a common thing. We discuss the nuances of this particular case, bring up several similar personal situations and discuss whether it's tacky or simply moving away from typical "wedding tradition".

item.title: Netflix's Ultimatum (Marry or Move On): Are Relationship Ultimatums the Ultimate Red Flag?
item.itunes:title: Netflix's Ultimatum (Marry or Move On): Are Relationship Ultimatums the Ultimate Red Flag?
item.itunes:subtitle: Do we think ultimatums are toxic and manipulative or simply setting a boundary?
item.description:
If you've watched the most recent Netflix reality TV toxic relationship disaster known as Ultimatum: Marry or Move On, then this week's episode is for you. Not only are we psychoanalyzing the shit out of Colby, Ray, Madlyn, Nate and other contestants from the show, but the basic & the brain deep dive into what the concept of an ultimatum is, dissect whether it's a toxic and manipulative habit or a potential way to setting a healthy boundary within a relationship, and discuss whether or not ultimatums can actually be a useful tactic within a relationship to move forward together.


Join us this week as we chat red flags, continue to bitch about influencer culture (Revolve Fest...we're looking at you), and discuss the gospel of "He's Just Not That Into You"



Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com

item.title: The Rise of Coachella + Music Festival Scandal
item.itunes:title: The Rise of Coachella + Music Festival Scandal
item.itunes:subtitle: Anyone remember Fyre fest?
item.description:
In honor of Coachella this weekend, we're talking about the rise and evolution of our beloved California music festival, from its roots to its struggles to its meteoric rise to fame. We deep dive into the history of Coachella (how it came to be), the rise of Goldenvoice, the inception of Stagecoach, and talk music festival scandal (from Woodstock '99 to the infamous trash fire known as Fyre Fest).


Join us this week as we chat music festivals and how some folks feel like they can get away with murder because of their tax bracket.


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain

item.title: Award Shows: Classy or Trashy? Dissecting The Infamous Oscar's Slap of 2022
item.itunes:title: Award Shows: Classy or Trashy? Dissecting The Infamous Oscar's Slap of 2022
item.itunes:subtitle: Could the slap heard around the world have been staged?
item.description:
This week Madi and Aleena deep dive into WHAT the hell happened at the Academy Awards Ceremony (aka the Oscars) this year. Not only do we discuss what happened, we review the series of events that have unfolded since the Sunday ceremony (Whether Will Smith was asked to leave or not, Zoe Kravitz and Jim Carry getting dragged for their commentary on the situation, new video footage of Jada Pinkett Smith laughing after her husband slapped Chris Rock, Will Smith's resignation from the Academy and more!), what the conspiracy theories around the event are (is it a PR stunt? Or staged to benefit one of the Oscar's sponsors?), and we provide a brief historical overview of the rise of award shows in Hollywood.


Join us this week as we get to dissect what maybe this year's most infamous pop culture moment.


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Twitter: @BasicandBrain
  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com

item.title: Botox & Zoom Boom: Has the Pandemic Laid Way for a New Form of Body Dysmorphia?
item.itunes:title: Botox & Zoom Boom: Has the Pandemic Laid Way for a New Form of Body Dysmorphia?
item.itunes:subtitle: Are BBLs a thing of the past?
item.description:
Starting off our episode this week, we talk avocados (and how hard it is to find a ripe one these days), the ethics of eating lab meat and how these new filters on Instagram are having Madz feel some type of way about her 30th birthday. Going into our junior year of the pandemic, we’ve seen a steady rise in cosmetic procedures (ie. filler, Botox, PDO threads, etc) and with Madi's 30th birthday around the corner and with the lines on her face showing, who better to teach her the ways of Botox and cosmetic enhancements than our resident self care and Botox guru: Aleena? Join us this week as we discuss the uptick in certain cosmetic procedures, and how Zoom Boom + a global pandemic may be contributing to the new form of body dysmorphia.



Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

item.title: The Metaverse, VR Porn & NFTs: Where Reality is Starting to Sound Stranger Than Fiction
item.itunes:title: The Metaverse, VR Porn & NFTs: Where Reality is Starting to Sound Stranger Than Fiction
item.itunes:subtitle: Nobody knows what it means, but it sounds provocative
item.description:
This week, The Basic & The Brain talk about the latest social/gaming/tech craze: The Metaverse. Not only do we discuss the concept and how it's a new medium of socialization (that may or may not actually be better than our real lives), we talk VR Porn and our experiences with it, and lastly, we touch on how the rise of interest/hype around the metaverse has paralleled that of NFT's and Crypto's and their potential use cases. We've got celebrities like Justin Bieber and Paris Hilton on the NFT train and it's not looking like it's going to stop anytime soon.


Come join us this week as we wonder if the Metaverse as a current concept is too amorphous, how its development may influence the internet and real world as a whole and what the next wave of socialization will look like (and how will AR/VR fit into that)?


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Twitter: @BasicandBrain
  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain
  • TikTok: @thebasic_and_thebrain
  • Website: thebasicandthebrain.com

item.title: Daters Stop Swiping: The Tinder Swindler and the Very Strange Realities of Catfishing in the Modern World
item.itunes:title: Daters Stop Swiping: The Tinder Swindler and the Very Strange Realities of Catfishing in the Modern World
item.itunes:subtitle: How are people getting scammed out of their avocado money?
item.description:
This week The Basic & The Brain talk about the latest and greatest from Netflix that has become meme extraordinaire across social media platforms: The Tinder Swindler. Not only do we briefly recap the documentary and discuss the extreme lengths Simon Hayut/Simon Levinson went to scam these women, but we comb through data on how common catfishing has become in the modern world, what factors make folks particularly susceptible to catfishing and what causes people to catfish.


Come join us this week as we try and figure out how folks are parting with their avocado money so easily, how Tinder is combatting the catfish phenomena on their platform and what's in store for daters of the future.



Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

  • Instagram: @TheBasicandTheBrain

Join us this week as Madi and Aleena review the types of parenting styles, discuss the differences between tiger moms helicopter parents, stage moms and Jewish mothers, and deep dive into how trauma makes you best suited to survive a zombie apocalypse (resiliency does build character they say).


Basic Bitch Quickies this week:

  • RiRi Pregnant
  • Kim and Kayne Update (Kim is clearly fed up with Kanye's ish)

item.title: And Just Like That....Season Finale - Episode 10 Review - "Seeing The Light"
item.itunes:title: And Just Like That....Season Finale - Episode 10 Review - "Seeing The Light"
item.itunes:subtitle: And just like that...we surprisingly want a second season
item.description:
It's the season finale and we never thought we'd say it, but we're actually sad the season is over! On this week's review we ask the hard hitting questions like how could Carrie not mention the sticky note break up, how is it cool to hook up with someone in the midst of a phone call (Seema we're looking at you girl) and how did the writers think Miranda choosing love over her career made sense given the entirety of her character arc, traits and mannerisms in Sex & the City? All in all, we still don't like Che, we're pretty annoyed with Rock and Madz gloats over her early season call out about the hot podcast producer.


Join us this week as we go down the rabbit hole on the season finale of And Just Like That where we summarize what we loved, what we hated and what we can't wait to see more of in upcoming seasons!

item.title: Influencer Pet Cloning: Sci fi Weirdness or Ensuring your bags?
item.itunes:title: Influencer Pet Cloning: Sci fi Weirdness or Ensuring your bags?
item.description:
This week we're taking an interesting spin on pet influencers and the rise of pet cloning. Are these folks trying to secure the bag or utilize these new advancements in technology to help them with their grief? What's the process (spoiler alert: it costs an arm and a leg)? What are the ethics? And would you do it if you were in their shoes? Come join us this week as we try and figure it out if this is sci fi weirdness (have we gone too far?) or an interesting development in what the future may hold for pet owners/fur moms and dads.


Basic Bitch Quickies this week:

  • Kayne spreading rumors that Pete has AIDs
  • Chris Brown getting sued: Jane Doe claims he drugged and raped her during a Miami yacht party

This week we're talking all things related to bachelorette parties, bridal showers and weddings. When did we decide it was ok to do a multiple day bachelorette party? item.title: Joe Millionaire: What do Women Really Want? Love or Money?
item.itunes:title: Joe Millionaire: What do Women Really Want? Love or Money?
item.itunes:subtitle: What's so wrong with being a gold digger? Or rather a "gold finder"?
item.description:
We're back!!! After a short hiatus of our regularly scheduled content, we're back with even more basic bitch topics to intellectualize. We decided to come back strong with 4 top headlines for our Basic Bitch Quickies this week:

  • All these deaths in 2022 (Betty White, Sidney Poutier, and Bob Saget)
  • MGK & Megan Fox are Engaged
  • Jason Momoa and Lisa Bonnet Split
  • Drake Accused of Putting Hot Sauce in Condom After Sex


And to top it all off, we're reviewing Fox's reboot of the show, Joe Millionaire. We talk contestants, debate on which of the men are cuter(Kurt or Steven) and discuss what's more important when looking for a partner: love or money? What's so wrong with being a gold digger (or rather "gold finder")? And did you know there's a mathematical model to simulate which types of gifts you should buy to avoid being taken advantage of a "gold digger"?


Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

item.title: And Just Like That....Episode 6 Review - "Diwali"
item.itunes:title: And Just Like That....Episode 6 Review - "Diwali"
item.itunes:subtitle: Aging gracefully or naw?
item.description:
Boy.....were we off in our theories with how this week's episode was going to go. Who knew Carrie would be buying a GAWDY apartment (which by the way was a shoddily built apartment on a soundstage), that we'd get to see more of Sima and ABSOLUTELY keep falling in love with her, and that Miranda's affair would be discussed in such a bizzaro way with her friends. In addition to the above, this weeks episode brought up some thought provoking questions like: would you decide to age gracefully or be all about the elective cosmetic surgeries? Thoughts on arranged marriages and would you lie to those around you regarding a fake relationship to make your life easier? And finally, did you know that the Golden Girls were the SAME age as Carrie, Miranda and Charlotte are now in the show? Wild huh?


Join us this week as we go down the rabbit hole on all things for the new episode of the Sex and the City reboot!



Don't forget to follow us, review our podcast and subscribe on our socials!

item.title: The Beauty of Christmas Traditions
item.itunes:title: The Beauty of Christmas Traditions
item.itunes:subtitle: What is Christmas really?
item.description:
The nostalgia is real for us this week as we run through our old and new holiday traditions, how Christmas really started (including some interesting historical traditions and where they come from), and when we learned that Santa Claus wasn't real.


In addition to this week's topic, Aleena walks us through her omicron covid nightmare in New York where she's still in quarantine (Thanks Santa Con) and how Covid has literally become the new "STD" of our generation. And for a good portion of the episode, we dive a little deeper than usual during our fan favorite BBQ's to discuss the most recent development with the Tristan Thompson and Khloe Kardashian scandal, Ben Affleck's most recent statements about his drinking and marriage to Jennifer Garner, and Selling Sunset's Jason Oppenheim and Chrishell Stause's break up.

item.title: Tragedy on the Set of Rust: When is Hollywood going to Learn?
item.itunes:title: Tragedy on the Set of Rust: When is Hollywood going to Learn?
item.itunes:subtitle: When budget and timelines dictate how safe you are on set
item.description:
This week you'll find that we're still sorting through our thoughts on the "And Just Like That" premiere. Beyond our continued mourning, we talk Alec Baldwin and the tragedy on the set of Rust. Who's to blame? What the hell is an armourer? What's their job? Should Alec have done the interview? And has this happened on set before? We tackle all of these questions and more. Join as we dive into how far Hollywood is willing to go to capture certain experiences and if the industry will ever really understand when it's gone too far.

item.title: And Just Like That.....We Mourn and Talk S***t
item.itunes:title: And Just Like That.....We Mourn and Talk S***t
item.itunes:subtitle: A Review of the EXPLOSIVE Intro of the Sex and The City Reboot
item.description:
Mads and Aleena had to drop an "emergency" episode this week to hash out everything surrounding the "And Just Like That..." premiere, where we dissect some of the major themes being brought up in the season (thus far), discuss the explosive turn of events that led to Peloton's stock crashing, and fan girl over Sarah Jessica Parkers impeccable and iconic fashion choices. Do we think Kim Cattrall would ever come back? Will Charlotte's character be exposed to further difficulties with identity and motherhood? Come join us as we talk sh** together, mourn together, laugh together, and so much more!

item.title: Selling Sunset : How Real is Reality TV? (Featuring Paul Imbro)
item.itunes:title: Selling Sunset : How Real is Reality TV? (Featuring Paul Imbro)
item.itunes:subtitle: Where we get the curtain pulled back and see what reality TV really is
item.description:
We're learning a lot this episode thanks to our guest this week, Paul Imbro. Paul is a former morning show and reality TV producer turned real estate agent in good old Los Angeles. As we deep dive into how real Netflix's Selling Sunset actually is (From all things Christine Quinn drama to how Jason Oppenheim and Chrishell Stause kept their relationship secret), we hear from Paul on how much is scripted, where we may have been blind to producer manipulation and what really goes on behind doors in real estate. We even get to hear about Paul's connection to the Real Housewives Franchise!

item.title: David Portnoy v. Business Insider: Journalism in the Age of Cancel Culture
item.itunes:title: David Portnoy v. Business Insider: Journalism in the Age of Cancel Culture
item.itunes:subtitle: When society gets its news from headlines
item.description:
This week we deep dive into Business Insider's recent scandalous piece on David Portnoy, founder of Barstool Sports. Though no criminal claims were made by Business Insider, Portnoy has made it his mission to clear his name. Not only do we walk you through what was shared in the article and discuss Portnoy's evidence, but this piece got us thinking about journalistic ethics in the times of cancel culture, how news is consumed these days, how hard a libel case can really be and the conspiracy theories surrounding the recent scandal.

item.title: Tragedy at Astroworld: Who's Really at Fault?

item.description:
Is it ominous that our 13th episode is about the Astroworld tragedy or is it just us getting paranoid? This week, Madi and Aleena go over what happened in Houston during the Astroworld concert, what could have led to the "crowd rushing", the potential of incompetence across event management and security and what this could all mean for Travis Scott.

item.title: Slutty Costumes and Fear: Why do we love Halloween and Horror?
item.itunes:title: Slutty Costumes and Fear: Why do we love Halloween and Horror?
item.itunes:subtitle: Pumpkin spice lattes, apple picking and horror movie season is upon us!
item.description:
Ever wonder why some folks LOVE Halloween and the start of spooky season? This week Aleena and Madi discuss Madi's favorite holiday of the year. What's the relevance of Halloween? Why do people love the holiday and celebrate it by watching horror films? And really at it's core, why are people obsessed with being scared? Join us as we provide some insight on the history of Halloween, the psychology of fear and the cultural relevance of horror films in the US. We love bringing a bit of light into the darkness (but not too much since Madi likes it a little dark ;) ).

item.title: The Bachelor Franchise : Manipulation at its Finest
item.itunes:title: The Bachelor Franchise : Manipulation at its Finest
item.itunes:subtitle: Do ugly engagement rings = doomed relationships?
item.description:
Ever wondered why some are crazier than others on the bachelor franchise? Join us as we talk about Katie’s season (in particular about Gregg Grippo), diving deep into some of the interesting science behind attachment styles (anxious, avoidant, and secure) and how the show does a good job of exacerbating insecurities and activating “crazy”.


We even talk previous season, Chris Harrison's sudden departure, and what being there for "the right reason" really means *HEAVY eye roll from Madz*

item.description:
Join us as we get knee deep in dissecting this week's messed up murder game. Through the macabre nature of Netflix's new hit series Squid Game, we explore themes of inequality (across race, gender, income and more), the demonization of the West, and run through some of the interesting fan theories out there, all while trying to stave off a panic attack.
